articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Jordanian King 
    Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Abdullah II, king of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, on May 24 on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the independence of Jordan.
 The message wished the king and the Jordanian people greater success in their work for the stability and prosperity of the country and the peace in the Mideast region, expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would as ever grow stronger.

Greetings to Yemeni President 
    Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to President Ali Abdullah Saleh on May 21 on the occasion of the 14th national day of Yemen.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished the president success in his work for the progress and prosperity of the country.

Greetings to Malawian President
    Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on May 31 sent a congratulatory message to Bingu Wa Mutharika upon his assumption of office as president of the Republic of Malawi.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow in scope in the mutual interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished the president great success in his responsible work for the prosperity and development of the country.

articles.content:
Greetings to President of Germany
    Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greetings to Horst Kohler, on his election as president of the Federal Republic of Germany.
 Expressing the belief that the DPRK-Germany relations would continue to expand and develop in mutual interests, he sincerely wished the German president good health and happiness as well as a great success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and the well-being of the people.
